unit_learning_outcomes.description: Critically appraise the strengths and limitations of a health promotion program
Apply the principles of planning and evaluation to real world scenarios with a pragmatic approach.
Identify and articulate appropriate research designs and methods for designing and evaluating a health promotion program.
Describe the key principles of planning and evaluation of health promotion programs.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Weekly readings that complement lecture materials

assessments.description:
Proposal for a health promotion program divided into four components:
1. Pitch presentation (10%)
2. Written report (20%)
3. Peer contribution (10%)
4. Reflection (20%)
Critical appraisal of a health promotion program

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.subject_search_title: HSYP8007 - Program Planning and Evaluation in Health Promotion

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: In this unit you will learn to plan and evaluate health promotion programs and assess their implementation and impact. You will apply knowledge and learnings from the classroom to real world scenarios using a pragmatic lens. This unit will prepare you to work as a health promotion practitioner, in settings such as local health districts, non-government organisations, and community enterprises. Assessment tasks will involve a combination of individual and group work, similar to working on a real project. To be successful in this unit you will need to have a solid understanding of disease prevention and health promotion.
data.search_title: HSYP8007 - Program Planning and Evaluation in Health Promotion
